title: 'Blueprint to sabotage election'
body: BNP has announced that it will hold rallies tomorrow across the country, including in Dhaka, in protest against the shooting of Dhaka-8 aspiring candidate Sharif Osman Hadi today. The party's Senior Joint Secretary General, Ruhul Kabir Rizvi, made the announcement at 4:50pm today, demanding that the perpetrators be identified and punished. Rizvi condemned the attack, saying, "Some are working according to a blueprint to sabotage a free and fair election and destroy a peaceful environment. As part of this plan, Osman Hadi was shot today, and he is now battling for his life. Previously, a BNP candidate in Chattogram, Ershadullah, was also shot and injured." Hadi, also spokesperson for Inqilab Moncho, was shot at Bijoynagar Box Culvert Road in Dhaka's Paltan by unidentified assailants around 2:25pm, said police. Critically injured, he is currently undergoing treatment at the intensive care unit (ICU) of Dhaka Medical College Hospital.
